CatDescriptText: Mr. Sam Karps, policeman, McKees Rocks and Mrs. Aline Mays, housewife, 830 Francis Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 7, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the United States is gaining or losing its prestige in the world?"  Mr. Karpa's answer reads: "Gaining.  We are helping everybody."  Mrs. Mays' answer reads: "I think we are gaining, because we are helping out here and there."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sam Karps wearing sunglasses, and dark suit, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Aline Mays wearing striped shirt, dark skirt, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
